hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime Breakout via ETF Flow Momentum
hypothesis_content.statement: When US Bitcoin ETF net inflows exceed $500M over 3 consecutive trading days while the BTC price remains within 5% of its 30-day high, a NEUTRAL-to-BULL transition occurs, with BTC outperforming altcoins by 6-10% over the next 2 weeks as institutional flows dominate.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Sustained institutional inflows at near-high prices indicate conviction buying, not just dip accumulation. The term spread condition shows futures market alignment. This combination often breaks neutral ranges into bullish trends as new capital enters.
entry_conditions: US Bitcoin ETF 3-day cumulative net inflow > $500M

exit_conditions.stop_loss: ETF flows turn negative for 2 consecutive days

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 60% of signals achieve >6% returns, or ETF flows prove ephemeral (>70% reversal within 5 days of signal).
